page.title: 09TRADE IN OLD BYFIELD
page.content: THE VILLAGE SCHOOL HAD A PLAYGROUND WITH A FENCE DOWN IT.THE BOYS PLAYED ONE SIDE AND THE GIRLS THE OTHER.THE TOILETS WERE OUTSIDE.THERE USED TO BE 4 PUBLIC HOUSES IN THE VILLAGE,"THE BELL",IN BELL LANE,"THE ROSE AND CROWN"ON THE CROSSROADS,"THE WHITE LION" IN BANBURY LANE AND "THE NEW INN" WHICH WAS IN PLACE OF "THE CROSS TREE". THERE WERE 2 BUTCHERS SHOPS AND SEVERAL SWEET SHOPS.RUSSELL'S GROCERY SHOP WAS NEXT DOOR TO THE POTTERY.THEY ALSO SOLD COAL AND BAKED BREAD.SOMEONE USED TO GET UP A T 4.00 A.M. TO MAKE THE BREAD AND DOUGH CAKES.THEY DELIVERED BY HORSE AND CART AT FIRST,THEN LATER BY VAN.A CARRIER USED TO GO TO BANBURY ONCE A WEEK AND WOULD FETCH GOODS IF YOU PAID HIM.THE CO-OP WAS ONCE THE POST OFFICE AND OPPOSITE IT THE POST OFFICE YARD.THERE WAS A BIKE REPAIR SHOP OPPOSITE "THE BELL".
